scene.name: intro
scene.line: This must be near the end.
You think?
Sure, you can tell they're all in crisis.
scene.option: You don't think it's a happy ending?
What makes you think they're in crisis?
What's the title of this film?

scene.name: happy-ending
scene.line: Sure, most of them are. But first everyone gets in a crisis, and that makes it more satisfying.
Excellent observation, ma'am.
I manage.

scene.name: crisis
scene.line: It's in their posture. See how the big one is all slumped there? If they were just introducing him, they'd want him to look tall and powerful. Now you see him worn down to almost nothing.
It's pathetic.
That's the idea, cricket.

scene.name: film-title
scene.line: I have the ticket here ...
Huh, it doesn't list the title.

scene.name: ending
scene.line: Do you think they'll start it over after the ending?
Yeah, they do that sometimes.
Good, I want to know how it starts.
scene.option: You want to see the beginning after the ending?
Maybe we can ask those folks in the pickup.

scene.name: flip-ending
scene.line: Maybe it's better that way.

scene.name: ask-truck-about-beginning
scene.line: They look like they're sleeping.

scene.name: people
scene.line: Do all these people know each other?
scene.option: I think they work together.
No, they just met.

scene.name: people-strangers
scene.option: The big guy just arrived.
The dark-haired lady doesn't trust anyone.

scene.name: people-coworkers
scene.option: The big guy is new.
The dark-haired lady is the boss.

scene.name: people-big-guy
scene.option: He's troubled.
He's trying to fit in.

scene.name: people-lady
scene.option: She's troubled.
She's just looking out for business.

scene.name: people-final
scene.line: Oh. OK.
How come nobody talks?
It's silent. Before your time.
`(To CONWAY.)` Do they just play old movies here?
scene.option: Probably so they don't have to give you speakers for your car.
I don't know much about movies.

scene.name: speakers
scene.line: The car speakers are my favorite part. You know they use radio? Just regular radio, I mean. Sometimes people bring a little transmitter in and jam the signal with some circus music or something.
Something loud and garish, that's what makes the best jamming signal. Hit all the frequencies. Ha!

scene.name: dont-know-about-movies
scene.line: No? That's funny, you seem like the type ... sitting in a theater watching some old cowboy movie ... big old bag of popcorn. Ha ha.
For what it's worth, I don't know much about movies either. I like TV ...
You know the difference between film and TV? A film is projected light that gets bounced off a screen. You see the reflection. With a TV, you look straight at the light.

scene.name: something-happens
scene.line: Damn, did you see that?!
`(To EZRA.)` I'm not sure you should be watching this, kid.
I'm not watching.
scene.option: Think he's OK?
I didn't see `that` coming.
Got to be near the end.

scene.name: hes-ok
scene.line: Oh, sure. He can come back from that. Big guy like him ...

scene.name: surprise
scene.line: Took a violent turn, there.

scene.name: near-end
scene.line: Oh, yeah. It's almost over.
Definitely.

scene.name: final
scene.line: We should get back on the road.
scene.option: Yup.
Let's just watch. See how it ends.
